message.content:
{"id": "120922", 
"title": "Bug 120922: 'Dirty Page' behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs to be improved", 
"description": "When editing the XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and then trying to switch back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed indicating that the changes need to be saved. The error message is 'Source page is dirty.' This behavior is confusing for users as it does not provide clear instructions on how to save or discard the changes. Additionally, the dialog box that appears is titled 'Error'.", 
"OB": "The 'Dirty Page' behavior in the XML Report Designer editor occurs when the user edits the XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and then tries to switch back to the Layout view. The error message 'Source page is dirty' is displayed, but it does not provide clear instructions on how to save or discard the changes.", 
"EB": "To improve the 'Dirty Page' behavior in the XML Report Designer editor, clearer instructions should be provided to the user on how to save or discard the changes when attempting to switch back to the Layout view from the 'source' view of the Layout Editor.", 
"SR": "1. Modify the error message to provide clear instructions on how to save or discard the changes.\n2. Rename the dialog box from 'Error' to a more descriptive title."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '120922', 'title': 'Bug 120922"Dirty Page" behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improved', 'description': 'Bug 120922"Dirty Page" behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improved Other pages cannot be used until the source is saved." (including the quotes). And then the user needs figure out how to save or discard their changes. Do you want to save the changes?<Yes <No <CancelYes would save the changesNo would discard the changesCancel would do nothing and remain on the Source pageIn addition, the dialog is titled "Error" (including the quotes). ', 'OB': 'If you edit the XML in the "source" view of the Layout Editor, and then try to switch back to the Layout view, you will get an error message indicating that you need to save your changes.This problem is the user has to figure out what he needs to do to save the changes (or discard them, which is even harder), and the error message is not very good.The error message is "Source page is dirty. ', 'EB': '', 'SR': ''}
